results.webTitle: Premier League pre-season 2016: a full list of all the clubs’ friendlies

results.firPara: • England defender has indicated he wants to join Pep Guardiola
results.secPara: Manchester City are stepping up their interest in John Stones after the central defender indicated to Everton he is keen on moving to the Etihad Stadium to work under Pep Guardiola.
results.webTitle: Manchester City step up efforts to sign John Stones from Everton

results.firPara: The nearest Leicester City came to making a long-haul pre-season trip last summer involved a 66-mile excursion up the M1 which carried them into South Yorkshire and a game against Rotherham United.
results.secPara: Otherwise the Premier League champions in waiting did not move outside the Midlands and seemed more than content to limber up for the campaign with friendlies at Lincoln, Mansfield, Burton and Birmingham.
results.webTitle: Premier League clubs embark on globetrotting pre-season – but at what cost?

results.firPara: • Former striker says station withdrew offer made in May
results.secPara: Stan Collymore, the former Nottingham Forest, Liverpool and Aston Villa striker, has announced he is leaving TalkSport radio station after not having his contract renewed.
results.webTitle: Stan Collymore to leave TalkSport after contract is not renewed

results.firPara: With Euro 2016 in France over, attention turns to Russia. Ever since the announcement by a grinning Sepp Blatter in 2010 of Russia as victors over England for the right to host the 2018 World Cup, it has been clear the country has the potential to host a fantastic tournament – but that there are also many things that could go wrong.
results.secPara: With two years to kick-off the World Cup in Russia comes with all the usual worries before a major tournament about unfinished infrastructure, overspending and potential stumbling blocks but with a few specific extra concerns thrown in. Here are some that could be worth looking out for as the preparations for the first World Cup in eastern Europe enter the final stages.
results.webTitle: Russia 2018: issues facing organisers of first World Cup staged in eastern Europe

results.firPara: Like continents drifting across Earth, change may appear to come slowly to the US womens soccer team, but when it happens, it happens with a mighty wave of tremors.
results.secPara: Coach Jill Ellis named her 18-player roster for the Olympics on Tuesday, selecting just seven players from the 2012 Olympic squad. Four players bound for Rio didnt play in last years Womens World Cup.
results.webTitle: USWNT's stellar roster shows why they go to Olympics as favorites

results.firPara: Willian has extended his deal at Chelsea to 2020. The Brazil midfielder had been a target for José Mourinho at Manchester United but has chosen to stay at the club he joined in 2013.
results.secPara: The 27-year-old was Chelseas most impressive performer in a disappointing campaign last season, earning him the player of the year award from the fans and his team-mates. He had two years remaining on his previous contract.
results.webTitle: Willian extends Chelsea contract to 2020 in boost for Antonio Conte

results.firPara: In todays Fiver Big Sam, motivational techniques and much more
results.secPara: In todays Fiver Big Sam, motivational techniques and much more
results.webTitle: The Fiver | The sheer wonder of his giganticism

results.firPara: The English Womens Super League is to be switched from a summer to a winter calendar. It represents a radical shift in thinking at the Football Association that has been driven by a determination to offer England women the best chance of succeeding at major tournaments.
results.secPara: The elite womens season runs from March until November with a months break from late May until late June but, from 2017, it will roughly mirror the mens game by moving to a September to May format.
results.webTitle: FA Women’s Super League to switch to winter season from 2017
